title: Senior Account Manager
content:
Here at Designworks, we’re all about creating true Aotearoa icons through design that moves people, business, and communities forward. We’ve being doing it for over 40 years now, and it’s all made possible by our people. This is the place where New Zealand’s best designers, thinkers, makers, and creators come together to create brands that people care about, experiences that matter and design that works.
About the Role:
As part of our Client Service team at Designworks you'll join this talented and committed team, working together to deliver best in class design for our clients and each other. You’ll be an excellent communicator and strong team player, working on high-profile accounts within a multi-disciplinary team. You’ll demonstrate your ability to forge strong partnerships with your clients as well as internally as a trusted advisor across a variety of innovative projects.
These roles are varied from small to large scale strategic, integrated brand experience work and you’ll hit the ground running from day one with responsibility for this diverse client portfolio. We’re looking for our next Designworker to bring the energy and spark to make big things happen.
Your primary areas of responsibilities are client relationship planning and management, project direction and management, commercial and financial management of assigned clients and internal resource planning and management.
Key Responsibilities:
Client advocate

You are the internal face of the client and the ‘knowledge bank’ about that client. Your task is to know as much about the client as they do. Your clients trust that you have their best interests at the forefront of all you do and view you/Designworks as a partner – not a supplier.

Client Relationships

Foster and maintain client relationships across assigned client and become a trusted go-to partner.
With your senior client leads, mine opportunities within your client portfolio to drive growth of client.
Build trust and respect that can withstand robust healthy discussion.
Provide brand guardianship - represent the client and exercise sound judgment at key internal and client reviews to ensure high standard strategic and creative outputs.
Harness the internal strategic capability to deliver updates and insights to clients.

Delivery

You are the do-er in the team, the catchment, and the communicator of detail and the lead on the day-to-day project management. Prepare creative briefs, estimates, budgets, and timelines – internally and externally.
Put together project proposals from small to larger/more complex proposal with guidance from the Managing Partner.
You are heavily involved in setting and monitoring the project plan for the projects you work on. Helping the team achieve the job on time and within budget is a goal – but not at the expense of process or quality. You need to be on top of the costs, timings, and progress of each job to ensure we are on track and raise a flag early if we are not.
Understanding of objectives of the project, processes required to meet objectives, timeframes and budget parameters and deliverables.
You help support the team in the day-to-day smooth running of the studio – booking meetings, navigating diaries, creative timelines, and contact reports, updating WIP’s and working in our systems and documents to ensure projects are well set up and managed throughout.
Assist in collation of financial information and the preparation and monitoring of billing information ensuring financial systems are up to date each month on all projects you work on efficiently to ensure 100% recovery across client business.
Make yourself available for mentoring or training sessions because these sessions help you grow professionally and in your role.

Required Skills & Experience: 

Strong experience in an account management role within a brand, creative, PR agency environment, or similar.
Relationship master – ability to develop strong relationships internally and externally at all levels.
High situational awareness and emotional intelligence
Proven track record of growing and retaining accounts.
Broad client category experience, managing a range of projects – from small to large scale strategic, integrated brand experience work.
A strong interest in keeping up to date with people, our clients’ businesses, and the broader Aotearoa New Zealand marketing sector.
An interest in trends, including technology, design, and marketing and how they can affect our clients offering.
Experience dealing with clients and brands that have multiple stakeholders, customer segments and markets.
A communication and problem-solving style that is optimistic, authentic, collaborative, open and responsive.
Strong organisation skills – you are planned, methodical and responsive.
Analytical – you can interpret information and translate it to a simple format.
Solid commercial and financial acumen – with attention to detail and the ability to see the big picture.
A passion and love for brand thinking, creativity, and customer experience design.
Team oriented and open to collaboration.

Please note: All applicants must have valid New Zealand working rights.
Designworks is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and courage those of all backgrounds to apply.
 At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
